result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel E. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joel E. Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joel E. Brown was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Discussion held; Court reviews plea agreement; NGI pleas other than the plea in 14CF277 are withdrawan; Court reviews def's rights; Court reveiws chgs and pens; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 14CF68 w/o enhancer; no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF192, no contest plea is entered in count 1 of 15CF89; no contest/NGI plea is entered in 14CF277 all counts; parties stipulate to facts; Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty as follows: count 1 w/o penalty enhancer in 14CF68 and count 2 is dismissed; guilty of count 1 of 15CF192 w/counts 2 & 3 dismissed and count 4 is dismissed and read in; guilty of count 1 in 15CF89 and counts 4 & 5 are dismissed and read in and remaining counts are dismissed; Court accepts plea of no contest/NGI in 14CF277 all counts and finds defendant guilty/NGI; Court heard and will order a 4 year commitment to DHS inpatient; Parties make sentencing arguments; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

Defendant Joel E. Brown in court, in custody with attorney Greg E. Vollan.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Review of info is waived; NG and NGI pleas entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Atty Vollan request court examiner be appointed.  Atty Klomberg request court appoint an examiner of its own choosing and w/o recomendation from the parties.  Court appoints Dr. Schoeniker .  Court finds basis for evaluation due to injury sustained and memory loss.  Court calls 14CF277 by stipulation of counsel;  this case is assigned to Br. 1.  Court modifies pleas to NG & NGI.  Court also appoints Dr. Schoeniker in that case.  Court heard on request for bail modification.  Victim makes statement, court and Atty Vollan questions witness.  Victim sworn at request of Atty Klomberg.  Atty Klomberg questions witness.  Arguments by Atty Vollan on request to modify conditions of bail.  Atty Klomberg heard, objects to bail modification.  Court heard and modifies bail:

$3,000 cash
Court lifts no contact provision w/JLR and her children
Court orders no abusive or violent contact with anyone
No contact w/T.T.  Telephone scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

(12:52) Defendant Joel E. Brown in court in custody with Intern Austin Heiman (Attorney Moeller) (will appoint).  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Address is 115 Henry Street, BD, WI; Court finds probable cause. State requests $20,000 Cash bail, more charges coming, no contact w/JLR dob 10/12/85 or her children or residence; Intern response - Def. supposed to have surgery this Friday on foot; Prelim requested within time limits; Prelim. 3/12/15 at 1:30pm in Br. 2; Court sets $20,000 CASH Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with alleged victim, J.L.R., dob 10/12/85 or her children or her residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. Def. remanded
